disobedience.question: Did you reject the unity of the Catholic church when frustrated with Church members, perhaps because they disagreed with your views or failed to meet your expectations?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected the existence of God, either through your own internal thoughts or in conversations with others?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

impiety.question: Did I fail to show reverence for Most Blessed Sacrament when encountering it in my community, travels, or at home?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

impiety.question: Did you fail to show reverence for Most Blessed Sacrament on occasions when it was exposed or venerated?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

extracted_data_phrases: particularly during moments of silence or quiet reflection
impiety.question: Did I fail to show reverence for Most Blessed Sacrament when attending Mass or participating in Eucharistic celebrations, particularly during moments of silence or quiet reflection?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.
